Class AddAppointmentController

controller.AddAppointmentController
All Implemented Interfaces:

public class AddAppointmentController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Author:
Hamza Yousaf Controller for the "AddAppointment" screen, Manages adding appointments to the database.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the Add Appointment screen. Invoked at screen launch, populates combo boxes.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The URL for initialization
      resourceBundle - The resource bundle for initialization

    • populateComboBoxes

      public void populateComboBoxes() throws SQLException
      Populates the form's combo boxes. Utilizes ObservableLists for each combo box's content.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If SQL database access fails

    • inputCheck

      public boolean inputCheck()
      Validates if all form fields are filled. Displays an error if any field is empty.
      Returns:
      true if all fields are filled, false otherwise

    • resetFields

      public void resetFields()
      Resets all input fields to their default state, allowing for new entry.

    • goodAppointmentTime

      public boolean goodAppointmentTime() throws SQLException
      Verifies the appointment timing. Ensures it adheres to business rules such as office hours and avoids overlap. Uses a lambda for efficient error message display.
      Returns:
      true if timing is valid, false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - If SQL database access fails

    • insertAppointment

      public void insertAppointment() throws SQLException
      Submits the appointment details to the database. Validates input and timing before insertion. Informs the user upon successful addition.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If SQL database access fails

      Throws:
